description: The ancient port city in Egypt's Nile Delta, founded by Alexander the Great in 332/331 BCE (BAtlas 74 B2 Alexandria).

properties.description: Understood to be the oldest necropolis in Alexandria that dates back to the Ptolemaic period and is located in the modern Chatby area of Alexandria.
properties.title: Center of Visible Remains of the Chatby Necropolis

properties.description: The Serapeum in Alexandria was a temple to Serapis erected by Ptolemy III in the 3rd century BCE. It was destroyed in 391 AD.
properties.title: Center of the visible remains of the Serapeum

locations.details: Points were digitized on June 19, 2012 by hand in Google Earth using 5.2.1.1329 (beta) at an "eye altitude" of 600 ft.
